result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin A. Good was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Absolute Sobriety of controlled substances and alcohol.

Defendant may apply for expungment if law abiding & fine paid in full within 36 mos.. Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015 and petitions w/in 1 year of eligibility.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin A. Good

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Extend probation 12 mos or until financial obligations are paid in full whichever comes first.

Defendant Justin A. Good in court.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  DE was to be here 10/30/17 for a probation review hearing, should up today to set p/plan and found out had warrant and missed court.  DE states had payment of $80.00 3 weeks ago.  DE has not paid anything in 3 years but the one payment 3 weeks ago.  State requests extension of probation.  Court orders probation extended for 12 mos. or until financial obligations are paid in full.

Defendant Justin A. Good not in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes hearing today set to discuss extension of probation so DE can make restitution payments.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin A. Good

Prior: 1015 5th Street, Baraboo, WI 53913
Probation review hearing on October 30, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
